questions.question: Which of the following would be considered an employer's rights and responsibilities?

choices.answer: Provide and maintain protective equipment, devices and clothing
Provide direction and delegate authority to those responsible

questions.question: Which of the following would be considered a supervisor's rights and responsibilities?

choices.answer: Know the worksafe guidelines that apply to the job
Ensure PPE are available and maintained
Investigate unsafe conditions and report them immediately

questions.question: Which of the following would be considered a worker's rights and responsibilities?

choices.answer: Make policies to make a workplace safe
Perform work in a safe manner

questions.question: A new worker is most likely to rely on his or her employer for training and direction concerning health and safety.
A supervisor cannot be held liable for a workplace accident unless he or she holds the official title of “supervisor.”
Upon promotion, supervisors always receive training in health and safety in addition to supervisory training.
Workers have the legal right to refuse work they have reasonable cause to believe is unsafe.
New workers don’t have any health and safety rights on the job — they can get fired for speaking up.
Two of the most important factors in preventing new worker injuries are training and supervision.
Employers are not responsible for assigning responsibility, accountability, and authority to supervisory staff.
